intro: Fagara ehrenbergii, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a berry that turns red when mature, containing several seeds. Fagara ehrenbergii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
